title: What would happen if Google shut down for a day? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well most of the things that we do are indirectly somehow related to google whether we had reached that website using Google search engine, by clicking on the advertisement on some other websites, by watching videos we got to know something, product of google, and many more. The losses that would occur would be huge as it’s one of the largest and biggest tech companies in the world. Let us take few statistics into accounts: Let’s make the advertising revenues ~$ 80 billion. Doing the math for the single day revenue in single day comes to about ~$217 Million. That’s a lot of money for us to imagine. After excluding the expenses and costs, the net figure comes out to ~$23 billion. 2. Google’s parent company earning’s in the year 2016 was $90.3 billion and revenue growth of 20% year over year. 3. You would be amazed to know that Google’s advertising revenue was $79.383 billion which comes roughly around 87.8% of the total revenue posted in the financial year 2016 which ended in December. That’s a staggering stat. * This doesn’t include the costs and expenses incurred by the company. Imagine if it shutdown in 2016 for a day then it would have realized a loss of $217 million and not just the revenue loss but many things more. People all around the world would go gaga as to why it happened and why such a big company isn’t doing or if it’s doing then why didn’t the operations started.There are 5.5 billion searches on Google everyday, and 1.2 trillion searches each each worldwide according to a research for the year 2016. This means google won’t be able to process 5.5 billion searches a day.Source: Google now handles at least 2 trillion searches per year  This is the data for the year 2016 and for 2017 it would surely be more. 3. Most of the people depend on Google Maps for the location details and it would be bizarre to not have maps as 69% of the estimated user base of Maps use Google Maps. People probably may have to switch to another maps and apparently no Live traffic updates. Source: New survey says Google Maps favored by nearly 70 percent of iPhone users 4.Stock prices would crash and it may see a bigger downfall. 5. Gmail is the most widely used email service and according to report it crossed more than 1 billion in 2016.  Source: Gmail Now Has More Than 1B Monthly Active Users 6. Android users won’t get the support required and won’t be able to use Google Play Store that means a huge revenue loss to the application developers as they earn from downloads and for the company itself. These are some of the things and much more could happen. Hopefully this doesn’t happen!!

A day is wayyy long. But let's assume that Google shuts down for 30 mins and see the consequences…. ————Flashback———— In August 2013, Google and all of its services came down briefly for 2-3 mins. And the whole internet traffic went down by a massive 40%. A similar incident also occurred in May 2009.  ————————————— Note that it was just for 2 mins. Imagine 30 mins. It’s highly unlikely but here is what I think will happen – First few mins people will check their internet connection. Some will even call their Service Provider. Some may even check for hardware failures on their side – which is still more likely than 30 min outage.People will then realise that it’s true. There will be a period of disbelief. People will desperately try to reload google’s homepage.People all around the world will start taking screenshots of the Google Server Error Page. [Likely 500]Your Facebook Newsfeed will be full of “OMG Can’t believe”, “I witnessed something astonishing” along with several images from previous point.People will search for alternate search engine – but how ? Most of them don’t even know that there are alternate search enginesBing and Yahoo will get huge traffic surge.DuckDuckGo( Page on duckduckgo.com ) will start trending on Twitter. People will realise it’s good. (That’s a search engine that doesn’t track you BTW)Many other internet apps – that uses Google Services in backend will also come down. Without GMAIL for 30 mins the productivity across the whole world will drop by a huge margin.I can’t even imagine the Revenue Loss – not just for Google but for all the companies throughout the world that uses Google.Android users will be stranded on the roads and iPhone users will be lost in the lanes if Google Maps stopped working for 30minsAmong all this fiasco Internet life in China will remain unaffected.People at other competitive companies will enjoy and sing songs (Meant to be a joke)After the outage is fixed and services are restored: Google will release their statement to the press – explaining the cause (may be)Tech Savvy people around the world will try to dig deep in search for the cause of outage.Many will speculate that a group of Hackers are responsible. People will then approach many Hackers regarding their opinionMedia will go crazy. They will call experts and try to analyse situation themselves.Many bloggers will write post about “How we are too dependent on Google? – A reality check”. Even Media will do itQuora would be full of questions – “Why did it happen ?”, “What do you think about the outage ?”, “Can it happen again ?”, “Was my data leaked?”, “Is it true that Google was hacked ?”, etc.A lot of users will switch from Google services to alternates.BuzzFeed and ScoopWhoop will have articles like “Google went down for 30 minutes. You won’t believe what happened next.” and “10 things to do when Google goes down the next time”.People will find this answer and realize that many of it is actually happening (Again, meant to be a joke)Time For Indian Version!  Let us first confront the reality that this is a possibility. I am assuming that such a ban will be enforced by the Supreme Court because the government simply cannot do it. I am also assuming that all Google services and Google owned products will be banned with an immediate effect without prior notice. So here is my take on the immediate reaction: Rahul Gandhi will try to blame Modi government for it but will end up trolling himself.Meanwhile some politicians will go on a hunger strike and ask the government to lift the ban.Indecent words will be spoken in Lok Sabha accompanied by loud thumping of tables.Sundar Pichai will receive an enormous amount of media attention. He will probably make a statement. People will ask him to resign.https://duckduckgo.com/ and Bing will receive huge traffic from India and they will be very happy about it.Life of most Indians will be disrupted and almost everyone will suffer.Needless to say Twitter and Facebook will be full of posts about this ban.Porn traffic will decline steeply.Uber, Ola and other services using Google Map service will all stop working. Regular taxi fares will suddenly jump.People won’t know what to do with their computers anymore. Internet Service Providers will receive huge number of false complaints that the customer’s internet is not working.Here is the aftermath : Google will suffer from huge financial loss. They will have to close their Indian offices.AIB will make a video titled “India reacts to ban of Google” and that will be funny. But wait where will they upload ? No YouTube. HotStar !Indian Media will go crazy and run reports about conspiracy behind the ban.At least 10 new startups will come up with Indian version of Google. Most CEOs will be ex-Googlers. There might be names like “Khoj” (Hindi for Search), “Tehkiqat” (Hindi for Investigation), “http://gINgle.com“, etc. There will be startups to replicate Google Docs, YouTube, Gmail, etc too.“Google ban in India” will become the most queried phrase on Google globally.The hype around Google hiring IITians will finally go away.International investors looking for investment in Indian tech scene will pull off. Source: What would happen if Google goes down for 30 minutes? ~SMR²

Google or internet in today's date has evolved a lot from where it was a few years ago. a day without the internet is quite harsh and we do know how it feels when the internet connection isn't working and the electronic device we use shows a failed connection. everything in today's sphere that we wish to know, we know whom to ask and where to search, goes without saying google for us in the twentieth century has become that one place where no information is missing and information, the most vital component for us to keep ourselves updated with various events happening around us, is available within a single click of the button or a single pointing of the mouse .such has been the importance of google that now it has become man’s new best friend, taking over from books ,which had occupied the place since decades. now imagine a day on earth , in the middle of a century which says, “google takes a day off, will be back tomorrow”. such a situation would feel similar to being trapped in an island without the supply of any essentials. google feeds our mind with the most valuable information and without it , our mind may feel isolated without its company.true ,saying such a thing i might sound sound a bit too over the top , but gathering information from books and getting it from google are vastly different experiences which differ greatly with the degree of convenience. with the advancement of technology things have plunged towards a better world , that is sophisticated in many ways and hence resorting to the old world where technology was absent and everything had to be done in a manual way is no more an option. google is that one stop solution to many things, using it on your smartphone and asking even the most trivial of the things to it , feels like having a Jarvis with you just like tony stark has one, who knows every thing and does its best to serve you. now after having said all of this, i would say , google is quite an indispensable part of our daily life that does a lot to speed up the life that is already in a swift motion. but if google is absent for a day, life would be nostalgic as one would be conscious enough to realize how great an advancement the advent of google has given to mankind. so, it would be one of those days, when past would be re-lived where depending on computers to gather information was a far-fetched thought.

Firstly lets try to overview what has internet contributed in our lives. Basically, faster and wider range of data sharing, communication and providing services. Thus, how the absence of internet would affect a particular person would depend on how is he/she engaged with any of these activities in that particular time frame. Thus, I would prefer drawing up domains called independents, partners and parasites for whom the outcomes could differ. However, anybody could flexibly be part of anyone of them. Starting off with independents, these are the people who would be successful in escaping unaffected from a crisis this concerning. This may include people who might be currently vacationing in some of the remote locations and have decided to stay out and explore may be for a couple of days atleast. There could also be people who may not be decently equipped economically or living in geographically difficult to access places. Thus, it is comparatively less probable for them to experience digitization to such an extent. Thus, a lack of internet may not affect them, atleast directly. Next comes the partners. These are the people who are using internet more or less daily. What all could be done here. social networkinglearningsome youtube streaminggames, music and may be moreAll of the above would come to halt. None of the above that you could do. I would fret the entire time. This could go down in the list of one of the sad days of my life and I am relieved that the question is restricted to a single day only. Some other activities could be pursued like maybe reading a newspaper (if not quora), going outdoors to a park, meeting up with friends and cousins, having a day off and treating it as a holiday. Thus, your happiness quotient would be proportional to the alternatives you could find and undertake the same rather than fretting and cussing the unavailability of internet. Finally, coming to the parasites. As mentioned above about alternatives and a day off , what if a holiday cannot be afforded. Think of the following few among all of possibles. Space programsMilitary and DefenceWorld EconomyHow freaked out an astronaut could become if somehow he realises that he has been virtually exiled from the planet for a day, and what repercussions could him/her not being in the radar, or his/her work not being collected be ? Defence personnel being stranded somewhere between their operation which may be taken advantage of by somebody else. World where stock markets and industries have integrally plugged internet on to themselves would stop. People won’t demand or sell any stock/goods. Thus markets could go in for a free flow which was previously being held by a constant demand and supply. In all, effects does not seem good. I don’t know exactly what part of the program would include internet services but looking at the basic functions of internet, we would definitely be missing a lot. Thus, I decided to place them among parasites.

Google admits emitting 1500000000 kg of Carbon Dioxide every year (It is published as The Big Picture - Google Green) even after employing data centers that use 50% less energy than the industrial average.  That's 4109589.0411 kg of Carbon Dioxide a day.As for it's other services, there are always good (and sans the interloping that Google 'gifts' us thanks to it's new privacy policy) alternatives. I admit that it offers advanced search features, but then very small percentage of people actually use them. So I'd say We'll have a greener day, without any intrusion.

Well let me look… I did a bit research and found out that once google went down for 5 min there was 40 % drop in internet traffic . If we break this down below is an infographic showing what all happens at google  Well the above is just for a minute. Do the math and you will get your Answer. Also as you asked if it shut down itself for a day then the amount of loss will be tremendeous. Source ~ sumocoupon , adweek .

- 1000s of blog posts would be written and posted. - Digital News agencies will not cover anything except Google.- Millions of discussions in forums, blogs, communities, etc.- No response would be there from Google Reps- An official post would be published on Google's Blog about the shutdown- Million of rumors- Twitter, FB and G+ will be flooded with Google shutdown discussions- 1000s of jokes would be exchanged- Microsoft will try to cash this opportunity ;)- Millions of developers and other professionals (who are surviving in industry just because of Google), might loose their jobs as they won't be able to deliver their tasks. But for search, people will use Bing/ Yahoo, and twitter (the real time search engine ;) )

Just by looking at the home page, DuckDuckGo is a trendy, popular search engine that can possibly move into the search engine gap left by Google. Yahoo leaves an aftertaste of 1999, while Bing is "2000-and-late" with its giant image interface and distracting, fun-facts across the page.  DuckDuckGo follows the same product design principles as Google - a simple search engine. They have some cool stuff on the side, like open sourcing good ideas for the website, unique doodles a la Google, and a uniquely awesome Goodies page, so I'd be pumped to see an adorable duck to take over a spot in popular culture that isn't voiced by Gilbert Gottfried.

First, million people will tweet about it, complaining how they can't access their google apps, can't google (search) anything. Many tech news will write articles about this shut down. Some tech blogger will write alternatives for all Google services (which I suspect is mostly Microsoft's).Inevitably, the following days Google will give announcement about the shut down yesterday. Google will explain why it happened and how they will make sure it will never happen again.In the mean time, Microsoft and Yahoo users are increasing.
It would be like lookin for something in the house without Mom for a day. You know its there but you can't see it.
People will Bing, Yahoo, AskJeeves etc... plenty of other alternatives out there :)

Well for me it will not be so much of a problem except gmail and youtube(considering youtube went shut down too being a google product). Here are the reasons. I too use google for searching because of its fast loading speed. But recently i found that duckduckgo is much faster and one page search site. I hardly open google site. I just search whatever default engine is there on my browser.There will be a great loss for google in terms of money. I will be very happy to see those companies go bankrupte how has become rich from our money and selling our information.There will be a great loss for many governments and agencies who take information from google for their use.Google play store will be close. Well i never download for play store. I download it from site apk. Let other site flourish too. Why only google.G maps. Well there are many other map services.Cloud storage. Well there are many other services.Google is just another major search engine that are just lucky to be on top. Its lucky that we overrated it. We underestimate the real godfather of search YAHOO. Google is just another money earning greedy site.

I'm surprised no one has mentioned Yandex. It's probably the best Google alternative. It's not as good as Google, but still better than Bing and Yahoo. I think a lot of people would find it, and start using it.
A lot of assignment deadlines won't be met.
Good answer to this one, is the reaction from Fortnite users, to their black hole end of game….

Nothing would work. Not even our phones. Everything is linked with google. Not just the search engine, but our mailbox, youtube and even our phones won't be accessible (android). So yeah, it would be a doomed day for us!
students would miss their deadlines...
The average IQ of the world would decrease by about 50.

Google doesn't scare me, but 2 years ago we literally got see what happens when AWS (Amazon Web Services) goes down. Basically the internet stops. All of the big websites that make up your day, suddenly disappear. An engineer on their team used the wrong wild-card character and shut down 2,000 clusters instead of 2. They've since taken precautions to prevent this, but shit happens. The good news is that the world didn't stop turning. People couldn't post their dank memes, but life kept on going.
Bing will say Yahoo and many people will just Duck Duck Go.

Simply, I wont google anything hoping that I will not face any circumstances which will force me to google… So without giving a second thought, I will rather stick to instagram, fb ,quora. …which are the sources of great pleasure that will efficiently pass my time!
1. I will miss the Google Doodle:(2. People will use other alternatives, because of which a couple of them would crash.
People would realize the importance of memory power.
We will have to find out if we have some dictionary software installed in our pc.
I probably wouldn't notice (proud user of Bing, Lumia, Surface and Xbox). Perhaps i'd probably just sound smarter than everyone else, or everyone else just becomes dumb.
It will give Google an opportunity to detect which markets or areas are still uncovered.
It would take down many businesses with it. AdWords/AdSense will get crashed for many publishers who count on that revenue.
In this case, I will start using one of these search engines. List of search engines - Wikipedia
It will look like a road junction which its traffic lights has a malfunction.
People need to find other website than google.com to check their Internet connection
